main_definition: A pen is a writing instrument used to apply ink to a surface, usually paper, for the purpose of writing or drawing.

meanings_and_examples.example: I need to buy a new pen because my old one ran out of ink.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A long, narrow piece of land extending into a lake or the sea
meanings_and_examples.example: The boat docked at the edge of the pen near the island.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Penalty for breaking rules or laws
meanings_and_examples.example: After cheating on the exam, he received a one-week penalty in the form of detention.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A device used to confine animals such as pigs or chickens
meanings_and_examples.example: The farmer built pens for his cattle and hens so they could be kept safely.
